A machete is a broad blade used either as an implement like an axe, or in 
combat like a short sword. The blade is typically 32.5 to 45 centimetres (12.8 to 
17.7 in) long and usually under 3 millimetres (0.12 in) thick. In the Spanish 
language, the word is a diminutive form of the word macho, .... There, the 
machete is called faco or facn (literally "big knife").
